title: Account Manager Corporate till Technogym
description:
**Vill du kombinera din passion för försäljning med ett genuint intresse för hälsa och välmående på arbetsplatsen? Vi söker nu en driven och resultatorienterad Account Manager som vill vara med och stärka vårt säljteam i Stockholm, med fokus på segmentet Corporate.** 




**Som Account Manager Corporate får du ansvaret för att bygga upp och utveckla försäljningen mot företag och organisationer – både genom nya samarbeten och att utveckla befintliga kundrelationer. Du spelar en central roll i att hjälpa svenska företag att skapa hälsosamma, aktiva arbetsplatser i linje med vår mission “Activating People” och vårt långsiktiga arbete med Hälsosamma Fastigheter, ”Healthy Building”. Vi hoppas att du vill vara med på vår spännande tillväxtresa och bli en del i vårt team!** 




  





**Om företaget** 




 Vi är exklusiv distributör av det italienska premiumvarumärket Technogym – världsledande inom träningsutrustning och wellnesslösningar. Vi är Nordens ledande partner inom träningslösningar, service och relaterade tjänster, och hjälper våra kunder att nå de bästa resultaten inom träning, wellness och affärsutveckling. Vi arbetar med en helhetssyn och långsiktiga relationer med våra kunder inom bland annat gym, hotell, företag, rehabkliniker och hemmaträning.
 



 I Sverige är vi ett engagerat team på 28 medarbetare, med vår HUB och showroom i Solna, vår boutique i centrala Stockholm, samt säljrepresentanter i hela landet. Vi har även en rikstäckande service- och underhållsavdelning.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 I rollen som Account Manager Corporate blir du en nyckelperson i Qicrafts satsning på företagssegmentet. Du ansvarar för att driva försäljningen av wellness- och träningslösningar till företag, kontor, fastighetsägare och organisationer som vill investera i hälsa och välmående för sina medarbetare.
 



 Ditt uppdrag omfattar nykundsbearbetning, relationsbyggande och rådgivande försäljning, där du identifierar behov och skapar kundanpassade lösningar. Rollen kräver en strategisk och affärsmässig approach, kombinerad med ett genuint engagemang för träning och hälsa. 
 



  





 Tjänsten innebär en del resor och utgår från vår HUB i Solna när du inte är ute på kundmöten, med möjlighet till flexibilitet vid behov.
 



  





**Ansvarsområden** 




 • Budgetuppfyllelse för segmentet 
 



 • Sälj- och mötesplanering, genomförande och uppföljning 
 



 • Arbeta proaktivt med nya kunder och partners
 



 • Proaktivt sökande efter upphandlingar och potentiella case
 



 • Utveckla och förvalta ”Healthy Building” 
 



 • Hantera inkommande leads och driva affären/avtalet i mål 
 



  





**Om dig** 




 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är målmedveten, självgående och har en naturlig fallenhet för affärer och relationer. Du trivs med att driva försäljningsprocesser från start till mål och inspireras av att skapa värde för både kund och företag. Vidare är du kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och arbetar strukturerad. Du trivs i en miljö där du får kombinera försäljning med ett meningsfullt syfte – att främja hälsa och välmående på arbetsplatser.
 



  





**Egenskaper** 




 • Mål- och resultatorienterad
 



 • God relationsbyggare som inger förtroende 
 



 • Strukturerad, systematisk och effektiv
 



 • Kommunikativ och serviceinriktad
 



 • Lösningsorienterad och en lagspelare
 



 • Har en sund och aktiv livsstil 
 



  





**Meriterande** 




 • Försäljningserfarenhet av produkter och tjänster B2B
 



 • Erfarenhet av att arbeta i CRM-system, gärna Salesforce
 



 • Erfarenhet från upphandlingar
 



  





**Krav** 




 • Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
 



 • B-körkort
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 • Att få arbeta på ett framgångsrikt företag med tillväxt sedan start
 



 • Att få arbeta med världsledande produkter och helhetslösningar
 



 • Att få arbeta i en spännande och högaktuell bransch
 



 • Personlig utveckling i ett engagerat och stöttande team 
 



 • Goda förmåner, inklusive förmånsbil 
 



  





**Anställningsform, omfattning och lön** 
  
 



 • Tillsvidareanställning (6 månaders provanställning tillämpas)
 



 • Heltidstjänst 
 



 • Fast lön med en rörlig provisionsdel
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev till rekrytering@qicraft.se, så snart som möjligt. Ange ”Account Manager Corporate” i ämnesraden. Rekryteringsprocessen kommer att starta omgående och fortgå löpande.
 



  





**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!** 




  





 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Alexander Hed, på 0733-71 30 82, alternativt via mail alexander.hed@qicraft.se

title: Huawei Nordic Talent Bridge – Global Research & Innovation Opportunities in Asia
description:
**About The Program**
 The
 **Huawei Nordic Talent Bridge Program** 
 connects exceptional PhD students, postdoctoral researchers, and young professionals from the Nordic region with Huawei’s
 **global research network in Asia** 
 , including R&D centers and research institutes in
 **Mainland China and Hong Kong** 
 .
   

  

 This program provides a unique opportunity to join Huawei’s
 **world-leading innovation teams** 
 , working on next-generation technologies such as
 **AI, wireless communication, cloud computing, and green energy systems** 
 .
   

  

 You will collaborate with top scientists and engineers worldwide and experience a
 **dynamic, cross-cultural research environment** 
 that blends global perspectives with Asian innovation energy.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Full-time or research internship opportunities at Huawei’s research centers across Asia
* Global mobility support – including visa and onboarding assistance
* Competitive compensation and access to leading-edge facilities
* Cross-cultural mentorship from world-class researchers and senior experts
* Opportunities to publish and co-author papers in collaboration with Huawei researchers
* Exposure to international innovation ecosystems in Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Shanghai and more.


**Who We’re Looking For**
* PhD students, postdocs, or young professionals with PhD degree
* Academic backgrounds in STEM fields such as:
+ Wireless communication / AI / Machine learning
+ Computer science / Cloud computing
+ Power electronics / Energy systems
+ Applied physics / Mathematics

* Fluent in English (Mandarin is not required)
* Curious, open-minded, and motivated to explore international research collaboration


**Application Process**
* Submit your CV and a brief motivation statement.
* Candidates will be reviewed by Huawei’s global research talent team.
* Selected applicants will be matched with suitable research teams in Asia and invited for interviews.


**About Huawei**
 Huawei is a global leader in information and communications technology (ICT), operating in over 170 countries with more than 200,000 employees worldwide. Through its
 **research hubs in Europe and Asia** 
 , Huawei is committed to advancing science and innovation through open collaboration with global academia and industry.
   

  

**Apply Now**
 Join the
 **Huawei Nordic Talent Bridge Program** 
 to accelerate your research career, expand your global network, and experience Asia’s most vibrant innovation ecosystems.
   

  

**→ Apply today and become part of the next generation of global innovators.**

title: Growth Engineer
description:
**Tl;dr:** 
 We’re looking for a full-stack growth engineer who’s product-obsessed. One month you’ll ship a feature that users can’t stop talking about. The next, you’ll tear into funnels, loops, and onboarding to make them 10x tighter. You think in code, but your instinct is always: will this make the product better and our users more successful?
   

  

**Coding skills + excellent taste + growth instincts + product obsession = you.**
**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, solve complex problems, and bring their dreams to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value high ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek people who care deeply, challenge us, and are driven to build something of lasting impact.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience building and growing products with high-performing teams
* Skilled at designing, measuring, and iterating experiments based on evidence
* Thorough and detail-oriented in setting up growth systems “right” from the start
* Strong product sense with ability to frame problems, prioritize bets, and push the right ones forward
* Motivated by technology that makes a difference and by seeing impact through measurable results


**What You’ll Do**
 In one sentence: Do what it takes to build a predictable, sustainable, and competitively defensible growth model for Lovable.
   

  

* Build new product features & experiences
* Build and run A/B tests to optimize product-led growth loops (viral, referral, UGC).
* Deploy the fastest solution possible to validate ideas and scale the ones that work.
* Help manage integrations with other apps - MCP and API based.
* Keep the product experience relentlessly Lovable while making growth the engine, not the afterthought.


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Many LLM providers
* DevOps & Tooling: Github Actions, Grafana, OTEL, infra-as-code (Terraform)


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**How Applying Works**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* Join us for a round of technical interviews
* Team intro calls with the team


 Apply by clicking the link below.

title: Senior Manager - Data Management and Enterprise Architecture Expert within Management Consulting
description:
**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly performing and experienced Senior Data Management and Enterprise Architecture Professional to join our team within Management Consulting. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data management, data governance, and data analytics as well as working with Business and IT Architecture, with a proven track record of delivering successful projects. This will involve working closely with clients to understand and approach their data challenges. This includes developing and implementing data strategies and enterprise architecture design to ensure data quality, compliance and the effective utilization of data for strategy deployment.
   

  

 The role can be placed in Stockholm or Gothenburg, depending on your location and preference.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Lead and manage projects in the data management and enterprise architecture area, ensuring timely and successful delivery
* Develop and implement data governance frameworks and policies to ensure data quality, integrity, compliance and security
* Drive and lead initiatives within the enterprise architecture domain, addressing strategic questions related to application landscapes, system integration, data flows, platform selection, and alignment with business capabilities
* Collaborate with clients to understand their data requirements and provide tailored data solutions
* Design and implement data architectures and data models to support business objectives
* Actively drive the collaboration with sectors/accounts and KPMG global capabilities to identify opportunities and drive business development
* Mentor and guide junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data management and analytics


 ,
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field
* Minimum of 12 years of experience in data management and enterprise architecture or related fields
* Strong knowledge of data governance frameworks, data quality management, and data protection regulation
* Experience working with modern data platforms such as Databricks, Snowflake, Microsoft Azure Data Platform, or other relevant technologies
* Hands-on experience with data migration, integration, and building scalable data pipelines across modern cloud or on-premise environments
* Experience with AI and machine learning technologies
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with clients and team members
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects and deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines


**Why Join KPMG**
**Global Network:** 
 Be part of a global network of professionals and gain access to international projects and knowledge sharing
   

  

**Career Development:** 
 Benefit from continuous learning and development opportunities, including training courses, mentorship programs, and career progression pathways
   

  

**Inclusive Culture:** 
 Work in an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone's ideas and contributions are valued
   

  

**Impactful Work:** 
 Make a lasting, positive impact on clients and society through meaningful and challenging work
   

  

 At KPMG, we are committed to fostering a culture of integrity, excellence, and collaboration. We believe in empowering our people to make a positive impact on our clients, communities, and society. Our values guide our actions and help us achieve our vision of being the preferred insights-led professional services firm.
   

  

 If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for digital transformation and a commitment to excellence, we invite you to join our team at KPMG and help us shape the future of our clients' businesses.
   

  

**Make a difference with us?**
 We welcome and look forward to receiving your application also during the summer, the selection process will begin at the start of August.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please contact Marie-Louise Bååth, marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se

title: Marketing Campaign Executive, Nordics
description:
At Pax8,
 **Stockholm** 
 , we’re not looking for a
 **Marketing Campaign Executive** 
 to just “run campaigns”. We’re looking for someone who sees marketing as a craft, who knows that a sharp local insight can spark a campaign that cuts through noise across the Nordics.
   

  

 This role is about more than impressions and clicks. It’s about being the Nordic voice within a high-performing EMEA team: shaping campaigns that matter, translating cultural nuance into creative that resonates, and turning strategy into results our sales team can feel.
   

  

 You’ll guide the journey from idea to impact, weaving data with creativity, local relevance with global scale. And if you’re the kind of marketer who’s curious, collaborative, and thrives where creativity meets analytics, then you won’t just fit in here; you’ll thrive.
   

  

**About Pax8**
 Pax8 is the technology marketplace of the future, linking partners, vendors, and small to midsized businesses (SMBs) through AI-powered insights and comprehensive product support, giving our partners for the first time a real choice. With a global partner ecosystem of over 35,000 managed service providers, Pax8 empowers SMBs worldwide by providing software and services that unlock their growth potential and enhance their security. Committed to innovating cloud commerce at scale, Pax8 drives customer acquisition and solution consumption across its entire ecosystem.
   

  

 Our servant leaders put employees first and we are about delivering exceptional employee experience to inspire customer experience.
   

  

 We are Pax8 where our employee experience meets customer experience – come and be "work happy" with us!
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Be Diverse And Impactful**
* Be the go-to person for digital marketing in the Nordic region, bringing local intelligence and cultural nuance into EMEA campaigns
* Coordinate and execute campaigns that align with EMEA strategy while targeting Nordic-specific MQL goals
* Activate campaigns across Google, LinkedIn, YouTube, Reddit, and other platforms
* Monitor and evaluate campaigns using analytics and insights; recommend optimisations to maximise performance
* Research the Nordic media landscape and test new opportunities, including beta campaigns and emerging formats
* Partner closely with global marketing and local sales stakeholders to align on pipeline goals and strategy
* Invest in your own growth through Pax8 learning programmes, Elev8 learning paths, coaching, and stretch projects


**More About Us**
 Best Companies: Awarded Number 50 in the UK’s Best Companies
   

  

 Our Journey from the US to EMEA: Office Opening – Bristol
   

  

 Get a feel for our progress, culture and how we constantly strive to be better and do better below:
   

  

* Taste our values & culture
* Our People Ethos – HR Leaders
* Awards & Recognition
* Pax8 named one of the UK’s Best Mid-Sized Companies
* Meet our new CEO


 We win awards for our people’s hard work and the positive experiences they have while doing it. For that reason, we are proud to have just been certified as a
 *Great Place to Work* 
 .
   

  

**🌟 What You Need To Thrive In This Role**
* Experience in planning, activating, and optimising digital marketing campaigns across social platforms (Google, LinkedIn, YouTube, Reddit)
* Strong stakeholder management and collaboration skills across regions and functions
* Ability to interpret campaign data and translate insights into clear actions
* Excellent communication skills — from writing briefs and copy to presenting recommendations
* Fluency in English and Swedish (Danish, Norwegian or Finnish is a plus)
* A proactive, innovative mindset with an appetite for emerging marketing tech and AI tools
* A self-starter approach — comfortable working independently as well as within a team
* The legal right to work in Sweden


**Salary & Benefits**
 💸 Salary:
 **486,000** 
 to
 **540,000** 
 SEK (depending on experience)
   

  

 🎯 Annual performance bonus
   

  

**Sweden Benefits Include**
* 💼 Long Term Incentive Plan (Stock Options)
* 🩺 Medical Insurance
* 🛡️ Life and Accident Insurance
* 🧠 Long Term Disability Insurance
* 🏦 Pension Coverage
* 📚 Dedicated time for training and personal development
* 🧘 Health & Wellbeing coaching support
* 🎉 Fun and frequent company and team socials


**Office Environment – Stockholm**
* Hybrid working: 2–3 days per week in-office
* Hotdesking and full tech setup for hybrid working
* Natural light and breakout spaces designed for wellbeing
* Regular social and community events
* Easy access to public transport and local amenities


**What’s in it for you?**
 There’s plenty of scope for a talented individual to progress quickly in this opportunity or move into other roles as we grow and expand. We have our very own internal academy (the Pax8 University) for personal development, plus access to L&D specialist trainers and extensive "born in the cloud" mentors for your growth. We’ll provide stretch projects, clear progression pathways, and opportunities to collaborate across regions.
   

  

 You might even get to exchange work location one day with your colleagues in the USA or across Europe — but even if you can’t travel right now, we guarantee you’ll still have fun!
   

  

**Why Pax8?**
 Our mission is to build the technology marketplace of the future. We are a fast-growing, dynamic, and high-energy organisation with a start-up feel, allowing you to make a meaningful impact on the business.
   

  

 Culture is important to us, and at Pax8, it’s business, and it
 *is* 
 personal. We are passionate, creative, and unconventional. We work hard, keep it fun, and expect the best!
   

  

 We Elev8 each other. We Advoc8 for our partners. We Innov8 continuously. We Celebr8 life.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 Pax8 is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes individuals who are in possession of the appropriate requirements to work within Sweden. Offered individuals will be asked to undertake identity, security compliance and reference checks. Your privacy is important to us. Your data will be held in accordance with GDPR best practices and processed only in accordance with our recruiting processes.
   

  

 Job Applicant Privacy Notice
   

  

**#IND-HP**

title: Azure Arkitekt
description:
Brinner du för att lösa problem och skapa smarta, hållbara molnlösningar? Vill du vara en del av ett gäng som värdesätter både innovation och arbetsglädje? Då kan vi vara din nästa arbetsplats!
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som
 **Azure Cloud Arkitekt** 
 hos oss får du en
 **nyckelroll** 
 i att hjälpa våra kunder ta nästa steg i sin molnresa. Tillsammans med våra konsulter och utvecklare bygger du
 **hållbara och skalbara molnlösningar** 
 – alltid med fokus på innovation, säkerhet och effektivitet.
   

  

 💬
 **Lyssna och förstå** 
 – Du jobbar nära kunderna för att förstå deras behov och översätta dem till smarta lösningar.
   

  

 🛠️
 **Skapa och implementera** 
 – Designa arkitekturer, bygga skalbara miljöer och optimera befintliga system.
   

  

 🔍
 **Analysera och förbättra** 
 – Se till att prestanda, säkerhet och kostnadseffektivitet alltid är på topp.
   

  

 🤝
 **Samarbeta och dela kunskap** 
 – Vi tror på att växa tillsammans! Du blir en del av ett team där vi inspirerar och stöttar varandra.
   

  

 🎯
 **Sätta strategier** 
 – Hjälpa kunder att förstå molnets möjligheter och bygga en långsiktig roadmap.
   

  

 Hos oss får du
 **kombinera teknisk expertis med kreativ problemlösning** 
 – och samtidigt ha riktigt kul på jobbet!
   

  

**Är det här du?** 
 🌱
   

  

 ✔️ Du har minst fyra års erfarenhet som konsult inom molnteknik.
   

  

 ✔️ Du har jobbat med infrastruktur, inom Azure.
   

  

 ✔️ Du gillar att hitta smarta IT-lösningar och har ett öga för helheten.
   

  

 ✔️ Du pratar och skriver flytande svenska, då det krävs i det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 🎁
   

  

**Flexibilitet** 
 – vi tror på balans mellan jobb och fritid.
 **Kompetensutveckling** 
 – utbildningar, certifieringar och en massa mer.
 **Härlig företagskultur** 
 – AW:s, konferensresor och roliga aktiviteter.
   

  

**Inkluderande arbetsmiljö** 
 – hos oss är alla välkomna och vi lyfter varandra!
   

  

**Vem är vi?** 
 🤗
   

  

 Vi är
 **B3 Cloud** 
 , ett härligt gäng på cirka 40 molnexperter i Stockholm och Göteborg. Vi är stolta över att vara en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser och vi brinner för att skapa innovativa lösningar tillsammans! 💡
   

  

**Om B3 Consulting Group**
*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på* 
 tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.
   

  

*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.*
 💌
 **Låter det spännande?** 
 Hör av dig! Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!

title: Principal Technical Consultant - Customer Workflows
description:
**Company Description**
 It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Senior Technical Consultant for
 **Customer & Industry Workflows** 
 is a technical responsible for guiding clients through the implementation of ServiceNow’s
 **Customer Service Management (CSM)**
 This role focuses on delivering best-practice-based solutions that drive business outcomes and enhance operational efficiency. The successful candidate will possess deep expertise in field service management, coupled with a strong understanding of customer service workflows, to solve complex client challenges and advocate for customer needs within ServiceNow.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 Project Delivery
   

  

* Act as the primary technical liaison for projects, representing the development team to customers and ensuring the highest quality of delivered solutions.
* Oversee technical delivery, ensuring alignment with client requirements and ServiceNow best practices for CSM and FSM implementations.
* Define and architect technical solutions at a detailed level, ensuring they align with clients' business needs and technological environments.
* Lead technical onboarding with clients, assessing existing processes and platform configurations to tailor solutions effectively.
* Perform hands on development on the ServiceNow platform leveraging all ServiceNow technologies and capabilities; Flow Designer, REST, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SSO, Mid-servers, and more.
* Serve as an escalation point for technical issues, implementing efficiencies and driving resolution of critical path challenges.
* Mentor and guide developers and consultants on best practices in technical design and field service management workflows.


 Pre-Sales Support
   

  

* Partner with the pre-sales team to scope complex service engagements involving ServiceNow products and intricate integrations with client systems, with a focus on CSM/FSM.
* Demonstrate thought leadership by contributing to webinars, whitepapers, and community groups, highlighting expertise in field service management.


 Product Collaboration
   

  

* Engage with ServiceNow product teams to provide feedback and insights on new features, capabilities, and best practices.
* Participate in go-to-market strategies for new service offerings, ensuring alignment with field service management trends and customer needs.


**Qualifications**
 In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:
   

  

**Experience:** 
 Deep consulting, configuration, and implementation of complex technologies, with at least 2 years focused on enterprise architecture and technical roadmaps
   

  

**Field Service Management Expertise:** 
 Proven track record in designing and implementing CSM, FSM & SOM solutions, with a solid understanding of industry-specific workflows, use cases, compliance requirements, and best practices.
   

  

**Domains:** 
 Customer Service, Field Service Management, Sales Order Management
   

  

**Leadership Skills:** 
 Ability to influence senior leaders and stakeholders, providing clear recommendations that address business and technical challenges in field service contexts.
   

  

**Technical Skills:** 
 Proficiency in creating architectural designs, solution presentations, and integration strategies, particularly within CSM & FSM environments. Experience with Web Technologies (XML, HTML, JavaScript, Web Services, Bootstrap, CSS, middleware, LDAP, SSO, etc.) and working with SaaS technologies
   

  

**Certifications:** 
 Must hold or be able to achieve within the first 90 days ServiceNow certifications for Customer Service Management and Field Service Management Implementation Specialist, and Certified Technical Architect within the first year.
   

  

**Languages:** 
 Fluency in Swedish and English is essential; due to the nature of the customer project, Swedish nationality is a significant advantage
   

  

**Mandatory**
**Required Certifications**
* Certified System Administrator
* Certified Implementation Specialist – CSM and FSM (within 90 days)
* Certified Technical Architect (within first year)


 When not having ServiceNow experience, then similar certification and experience for example with Salesforce:
   

  

* Salesforce Service Cloud Consultant
* Salesforce CTA
* Salesforce Field Service Lightning


 This role is ideal for a technical expert passionate about driving field service transformation and customer service excellence through innovative ServiceNow solutions.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

**Work Personas**
 We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.
   

  

**Accommodations**
 We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.
   

  

**Export Control Regulations**
 For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.
   

  

 From Fortune. ©2024 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

title: Teknisk OT/IT säkerhetskonsult
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Efterfrågan på våra tjänster ökar och vi behöver därför förstärka vårt team som arbetar med OT&IT Säkerhet. Är du vår nästa i raden av tekniska specialister?
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid det personliga och din konsult mässighet. Du kommer att lära dig mycket hos oss, och vi hjälper dig att utvecklas i din karriär. Du bör vara en lagspelare då vi ofta arbetar i breda team.
   

  

 I detta fall är det en rekrytering mot ett befintligt uppdrag, som konsult i kunduppdrag.
   

  

 Som konsult inom OT-/IT-säkerhet hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och intressanta kunder i uppdrag mot industri och kritisk infrastruktur. Baserat på din erfarenhet och kunskap kommer du att få möjlighet att arbeta i olika projekt och uppdragsteam. Områden vi ser att du kan komma att arbeta inom som rör denna rekrytering:
   

  

* Drift och nyinstallationer i industriella miljöer i en stor variation av olika tekniska lösningar
* Installationer av Windows och Linux baserade plattformar
* Några års arbete med Windows Server och virtualiserings plattformar
* Säkerhetsuppdateringar och applikations uppgraderingar men även säkerhetslösningar så som smartcards och federations tjänster
* Proaktivt löpande hantering av kundmiljöer med höga säkerhetsrutiner
* Kravhantering och krav mitigering
* Migreringar och patchning


 Uppdraget utförs i huvudsak på plats hos kund i Stockholm.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som är driven och nyfiken och vill göra samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har flera års erfarenhet av OT- & IT-relaterade arbeten. Du har framförallt arbetat med drift, underhåll och installationer helst i komplexa miljöer. Du är en skicklig problemlösare och har lätt för att samarbeta med andra. Du har troligtvis erfarenhet av tekniskt säkerhetsarbete och både kunskap och arbetslivserfarenhet av hur brandväggar, switchar och servrar konfigureras och installeras. Det är fördelaktigt om du även har god kännedom om nätverks infrastruktur vid felsökning etc.
   

  

 Du har arbetslivserfarenhet av nedan:
   

  

* Windows Server och Linux
* Windows Active Directory och SCCM
* GPO
* CS och PKI
* Certifikat hantering
* Kunskaper om HSM, FIPS 140-3, loggning i windows
* Arbeta med teknisk planering (t.ex. val av IPAM, SIEM, virtualisering, disaster recovery backup, nätverksprodukter och fysisk nätverksplanering).
* Installation av hårdvara, mjukvaror och special lösningar
* Hyper V och andra virtualiserings plattformar


*För många av våra uppdrag krävs
 **svenskt medborgarskap** 
 då säkerhetsprövning och registergodkännande är en del för att komma in hos flera uppdragsgivare pga försvarsrelaterad verksamhet. Godkänd säkerhetsprövning är ett krav för anställning.*
**Ytterligare information**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan, sista ansökningsdag är 20 september.**
**Kontaktperson för frågor:**
 Michael Blom, michael.blom@afry.com
   

  

 Sektionschef Cyber Linköping
   

  

 Ellinor Danielsson, ellinor.danielsson@afry.com
   

  

 Rekryteringspartner AFRY
   

  

*Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.*
*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Data Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 - We want a data-obsessed engineer to build Lovable’s data and analytics muscle. You’ll work cross-functionally across all teams to empower everyone with the insights they need for data-driven decision making. Must combine serious coding skills with the ability to turn complex data into winning product bets.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* A strong engineer with serious data infrastructure chops
* 5+ years of experience building data platforms or 3+ years with startup experience
* Past experience building up data infrastructure and pipelines to dashboards, reports and insights
* Obsession with understanding why users do what they do
* Strong opinions about the best data platform tools
* Startup and ex-Founder experience is an asset, especially if you’ve built up the data platform from the ground up


**What You’ll Do**
* Design, build and maintain scalable data pipelines and infrastructure
* Develop and optimize data models, warehouses and lakes
* Ensure data quality, reliability and consistency through validation and monitoring tools
* Work cross functionally across teams to ensure they are data-driven and can leverage your data system


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Many LLM providers
* DevOps & Tooling: Github Actions, Grafana, OTEL, infrastructure-as-code (Terraform)


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an intro call with recruiter.
* Complete the general programming exercise.
* Show us how you approach problems during several technical interviews.
* Tell us about your most impressive project.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: GCP Data Engineer Stockholm
description:
**GCP Data Engineer**
 Do you want to build the next data models for AI, ML, and data warehouse-powered solutions?
   

  

 Nexer Insight invites you to embark on a journey as a
 **GCP Data Engineer** 
 , where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits.
   

  

 Do you want to be our next
 **”** 
**Data Ninja** 
**”** 
**?**
 Joining Nexer Insight means becoming a vital part of a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. Here, you'll have the chance to work with cutting-edge technologies on
 **Google Cloud** 
 , including BigQuery, Dataflow, and Dataproc. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities.
   

  

 Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. Dive into the exciting intersection of data engineering and data science, where you'll have the chance to make a meaningful impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and operate scalable and robust analytical models.
* Set up data platforms and build data models and pipelines.
* Innovate and collaborate with customers to learn and find new business opportunities.
* Become a champion in best practices regarding architecture, data quality, reliability, and performance.
* Be at the forefront of the latest data engineering technology.
* Leverage Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services for data processing, transformation, and storage.
* Propel progress and ensure delivery by constructing top-tier cloud solutions, empowering our customers to adopt a data-driven approach.


**What We** 
**’** 
**re Looking For**
 Based on our criteria for the role, we expect you to have:
   

  

* Minimum 5 years of experience working as a Data Engineer.
* Minimum 2 years of hands-on project experience of working with GCP.
* Experience working with ETL tools such as BigQuery, Dataflow, Dataproc, or DBT.
* Experience with Data Lakes or Lakehouse Architecture.
* In-depth knowledge of SQL syntax.
* Experience in information and dimensional modelling.
* Good knowledge of DevOps processes with git version control and CI/CD methodology.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.


**Meritorious Experience**
* Certifications such as Google Cloud Professional Data Engineer.
* Experience in Governance tools for GCP , for an exaple Data Catalogue
* Platform modernisation.
* Experience with Google Cloud Infrastructure setup.
* Data Vault modelling.


**Why Join Us?**
 At Nexer Insight, you'll work with the latest technology in data engineering while being part of a supportive and innovative team. We are proud of our commitment to personal growth, offering certifications, training, and exciting projects with leading clients.
   

  

 Apply today to become part of Nexer Insight's journey!

title: Experienced Consultant in Energy Infrastructure
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you passionate about driving successful transformation that creates real value? Do you want to be at the forefront of the Green Transition and help shape the future of
 **sustainable, low-carbon energy systems?** 
 Are you looking to work in a flexible, inclusive, collaborative, and purpose-driven environment?
   

  

 We are seeking an experienced management consultant with deep Energy Industry expertise. Passionate for navigating and driving a sustainable green energy transition. You will join our Global Energy team, as well as our local Swedish community within Ramboll Management Consulting, working with Ramboll’s key clients in the Energy space.
   

  

**The role**
 As a Manager/Senior Manager in the Global and local Energy team, you will work as a Management Consultant in the front line, helping Energy companies develop strategies, lead large projects, and identify solutions to pursue opportunities and tackle the complexity of the energy transition.
   

  

 The role involves working with local and global clients, leading strategy and transformation projects, ensuring further development and success in developing energy transformation & strategies across the private and public sector. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams across the wider Ramboll community, integrating technical, sustainability and resilience expertise into project execution. In doing so you will drive successful transformation to create value for clients.
   

  

**Your key tasks and responsibilities will be:**
* Driving opportunities, growth and development in infrastructure (DSO/TSOs) and renewable energy production, in Sweden and the Northern European Market.
* Strengthening our Transformation/PMO capabilities with a dedicated focus on energy utilities.
* Key account management and business development
* Building long-term client relations, utilizing Ramboll’s existing Key Account setup and your own network to expand and deepen client relationships.
* Further build and develop the team, including coaching, mentoring, and capability building and driving career development for junior team members
* Ensuring project delivery with a focus on client management, quality assurance, and building deep, long-term relationships that position Ramboll as the strategic partner.
* Collaborating with Ramboll’s engineering, sustainability, resilience and EHS experts to bring technical depth and deliver integrated, cross-disciplinary energy transition solutions


 From the moment you start at Ramboll, we will support your personal and professional development so that you can continue to grow with the company. Whilst we look forward to supporting your continued learning and development, for this role we have identified some qualifications, skills, and capabilities that will set you up for success.
   

  

**For this role, we believe your starting point is:**
* 5-10 years of experience in management consulting, preferably with a background from top-tier strategy or energy transition consulting.
* Proven track record of leading and managing projects and clients in Energy space
* Extensive experience in one or more key areas of the energy transition, such as infrastructure or renewable energy production,
* Proven consulting experience in leading and building client accounts and teams.
* Strong communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills for driving progress and succeeding through teamwork
* A reliable, solution-oriented and structured approach to work, with the ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment


**What We Can Offer You**
* Flexible working environment
* Commitment to your development
* Leaders guided by our Leadership Principles
* A culture that welcomes you as the unique person you are
* Inspiration from colleagues, clients, and projects
* The long-term thinking of a foundation-owned company


**About The Global Energy Team At Ramboll Management Consulting**
 Ramboll Management Consulting is the advisory arm of the global consulting, engineering and architectural firm Ramboll. We specialize in the Energy Industry, focusing on both public and private sector clients. Our team combines deep industry knowledge with strategic consulting to help clients navigate the complexity and be competitive in the energy transition landscape.
   

  

 We provide expert advice across the Energy space – from strategic planning and business model development to transactions, operational optimization, implementation and sustainable transformation. Enabling our clients to succeed.
   

  

 Leveraging Ramboll’s extensive engineering expertise, our team positions Ramboll Management Consulting as the leading management consultancy driving sustainability transformation and energy transition. We serve as a trusted thought leader and strategic partner to our clients in the Energy space.
   

  

**Your application**
 Please attach a CV and cover letter to your application. Working language will be both English and Swedish. We look forward to your application as soon as possible and no later than 2025-11-09

title: Channel Systems Engineer - Nordics
description:
**Company Description**
 Arista Networks is an industry leader in data-driven, client-to-cloud networking for large data center, campus and routing environments. What sets us apart is our relentless pursuit of innovation. We leverage the latest advancements in cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and software-defined networking to provide our clients with a competitive edge in an increasingly interconnected world. Our solutions are designed to not only meet the current demands of the digital landscape but to also anticipate and adapt to future challenges.
   

  

 At Arista we value the diversity of thought and perspectives that each employee brings to the table. We believe that fostering an inclusive environment, where individuals from various backgrounds and experiences feel welcome, is essential for driving creativity and innovation.
   

  

 Our commitment to excellence has earned us several prestigious awards, such as Best Engineering Team, Best Company for Diversity, Compensation, and Work-Life Balance. At Arista, we take pride in our track record of success and strive to maintain the highest standards of quality and performance in everything we do.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Who You'll Work With**
 We are looking for an entrepreneurial Channel Presales Engineer to be focused on creating and growing the Channel business within our growing organisation in the Nordic region with regular travel regularly to our regional partners within the territory, Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland.
   

  

 We're looking for somebody based in either Denmark or Sweden.
   

  

 If you thrive in a fast moving, results-oriented, and rewarding environment, take a closer look at Arista Networks.
   

  

 Ideally you will have a technical background in networking and exposure to Data Center, Campus and Wi-Fi networking technologies - Arista, Cisco, Juniper, Extreme etc. Maybe you are currently a Technical Account Manager or Sales Engineer in a networking vendor or partner organisation. Ideally you will have a background in Pre-Sales Engineering and will be well versed in networking technologies.
   

  

 This role requires an individual who is a self-starter and can demonstrate sales leadership skills, deep technical skills and delivering training and product focus to partners. The candidate will also need to develop an extended eco-system of technology and business partners as well as target and attend industry events to drive lead generation as well as running webinars with regular cadence to better connect with and build relationships with partners.
   

  

 Key to the candidate’s success will be their ability to identify and qualify opportunities and RFPs and executing an engagement plan which creates pipeline opportunities across Arista’s entire portfolio. There is a clear expectation that the candidate will have an appreciation of technology and be able to translate customer priorities into Arista’s differentiated solutions.
   

  

 Join a team which is driving the transformation to Software Defined Cloud Networking via automated solutions to a named list of Enterprise accounts.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Exceed measurable sales objectives and extend the Arista brand within the channel
* You will be responsible for utilising a consultative selling approach with key partners to address the business needs of hybrid cloud computing and siloed legacy IT systems across the Arista product portfolio.
* Qualifying new opportunities and delivering sales presentations and RFPs.
* Meet with key decision-makers to present Arista’s value proposition.
* Partner with the Nordic Systems Engineering team to design and position compelling solutions that drive down the total cost of ownership
* Collaborate with channel partners to identify prospects and demonstrate best-in-class solutions; be willing and able to build a strong relationship and drive joint pipeline building activities with key partners within the Territory.
* Conduct demand generation activities such as happy hours, lunch-n-learns, webinars and technology forums; Able to direct, build, and manage a demand creation campaign for the Territory encompassing all aspects of marketing, PR and all aspects of pipeline creation.
* Collaborate with Arista peers on marketing plans and best practices.
* Keep up-to-date with technology partner solutions, competing solutions and competitor strategies.
* Articulate in communicating the steps and dependencies to closure, while managing expectations via accurate Forecasting/ reporting and open communication within Arista, Channel, and Eco / Business partners.


**Qualifications**
* A minimum of 5 years of commercial or technical experience with a working knowledge of selling networking equipment (Router, Switch, SDN, SD-WAN, Campus Networks, Network Virtualization, NFV), data centre, and/or network automation solutions are prerequisites.
* Fluent in speaking Swedish, Danish or Norwegian. Finnish is optional. Fluency in English also is essential.
* Proven track record of pursuing and closing deals with partners or end customers.
* Currently resident in either Sweden or Denmark - we do not offer relocation. This is a home working / field based role to meet customers.
* Bachelor Degree or equivalent in Computer Science / Networking. MBA desirable.
* Demonstrated people skills and ability to cultivate and maintain relationships at all levels.
* Proven track record of building business plans, documenting the processes, and exceeding sales targets.
* Ability to travel regularly to our regional partners within the territory, Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland.

title: Lösningsspecialist
description:
Hos HappiRel är vi inte så många (än), men vi är desto mer engagerade. Vi hjälper företag att få ut det bästa av Zendesk, och det gör vi med hjärta, humor och ett stort fokus på att skapa wow-upplevelser för våra kunder.
 



 Nu letar vi efter dig som vill ta stort ansvar och vara en viktig del av ett litet men kraftfullt team. 
 
 Hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i hur våra kunder upplever både Zendesk och HappiRel.  
 




  





  






 🏎️💨 Skaffa dig en snabb uppfattning
 



* Vi söker dig som vill jobba med kundleveranser i olika projekt
* HappiRel är en start-up, och detta är en roll med mycket frihet under ansvar
* Vi levererar med expertis inom branschen
* Du trivs på ett mindre företag, och värdesätter verkligen frihet och flexibilitet, och är proaktiv och engagerad
* Vi jobbar nära våra kunder, kollegor och partners, 
 *Happy Relations* 
  är A och O i vår verksamhet



  






 💻 Vad gör vi om dagarna ?
 




  





 Vi är en svensk Zendeskpartner och vi hjälper företag att blir bäst i välden på kundservice. Vi implementerar och vidareutvecklar det tekniska, samt våra kunders arbetssätt och deras kundkommunikation. Dag ut och dag in jobbar vi med olika avdelningar (primärt kundtjänst/support) på olika företag och hjälper dom med sin CX och support/kundservice. Det kan vara allt från hur de ska kommunicera med sina kunder till hur de jobbar mest effektivt i sina processer, och däremellan pratar vi om integreringar till andra system, AI-botar, statistik, CX, och allt som hör till.
 



  





  









  





  






 🫶 Vilka är HappiRel
 




  





 Vi är ett växande bolag och eftersom du kommer ombord tidigt på resan så är det inte bara en möjlighet, snarare en förväntan, att du likt oss vill vara med och driva bolaget framåt med allt vad det innebär
 



  





 För oss är det viktigt att vi trivs och har kul på jobbet och med varandra. På riktigt. Vi tar snabba beslut och värdesätter vår frihet och flexibilitet väldigt högt. Som medarbetare på HappiRel behöver du förstå och anamma frihet under ansvar. Alla är med och påverkar, funderar och provpratar (som vi brukar säga). Vilka vi är och vad vi levererar, teamet och vår kultur - är otroligt viktigt, och det är de som skapar vår vibe.
 



  





  





  🪩 
 
 Som CX Konsult på HappiRel kommer du att
 



* Tillhöra leveransavdelningen på HappiRel och jobba med våra kundleveranser
* Driva olika typer av projekt tillsammans med våra kunder
* Onboarda nya kunder in i systemet (Zendesk)
* Genomföra teknisk implementation, workshops & konsultation
* Genomföra utbildningar för våra kunder; Behovsanpassade, Användar- och administratörsutbildningar i systeme
* Hantera supportärenden


- 



 Vad vi vill att du har
 



* Flytande i både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift
* Erfarenhet av kundservice från ett ledarskaps- eller strategiskt perspektiv
* Erfarenhet av distansarbete och förmåga att självständigt driva ditt egna arbete
* Goda kommunikationsförmågor
* Förmågan att lyssna på våra kunders behov, identifiera förbättringsområden och genomföra förändring tillsammans med kund




 Annat meriterande är
 



* Erfarenhet inom Zendesk eller andra ärendehanteringssystem
* Tekniskt intresse och förståelse för digitala system
* Erfarenhet av att planera, driva och slutföra projekt
* Erfarenhet av konsultjobb
* Förmåga att tänka utanför boxen samt kaffedrickare ☕️



  





  





  






 Till dig som vill söka detta jobb
 




 Ett CV säger en del, men inte vem du är eller varför du vill jobba just hos oss.
 



  





 Det här är en unik roll så för oss är det viktigt att förstå vem du är, varför du söker rollen och vad som gör att just du skulle passa hos oss.
 



  





 Vi är ett litet bolag med stora ambitioner, och en stark entreprenörsanda.
 



 Här är man inte bara en i mängden, utan en viktig del av något vi bygger tillsammans.
 



 Berätta gärna varför du vill hoppa på just vårt äventyr och vad som gör att du passar för den här rollen.

title: Sr Data Architect, Data Lake & Analytics, ProServe SDT North
description:
**Description**
 Are you a Data Analytics specialist? Do you have Data Warehousing and/or Hadoop/Data Lake experience? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale (billions + records) data challenges in the world today? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners use cloud computing to do big new things faster and at lower cost? Do you want to be part of history and transform businesses through cloud computing adoption? Do you like to work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects that use the newest data analytic technologies? Would you like a career path that enables you to progress with the rapid adoption of cloud computing?
   

  

 At AWS, we are hiring the best Data / Analytics cloud computing consultants, who can help our clients and partners derive business value from Data in the cloud. Our consultants will collaborate with partner and client teams to deliver proof-of-concept projects, conduct topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as Machine Learning, IoT, batch/real-time data processing, Data and Business intelligence. This role will specifically focus on Data processing capabilities and helping our customers and partners to remove the constraints that prevent our customers from leveraging their data to develop business insights.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* As Senior Consultant you will lead complex projects with autonomy and discretion, often involving multiple Amazon and customer teams.
* You will work with customers and partners, leading them through planning, prioritization and delivery of complex transformation initiatives, while collaborating with relevant Sales and Service Teams.
* You will design and deliver solutions that solve for new levels of complexity, scale and performance, and in turn, enable breakthrough innovations.
* You will create and apply frameworks, methods, best practices and artifacts that deliver prescriptive guidance to customers, and publish and present them in large forums and across various media platforms.
* You will guide customers’ technical architecture and investments, maximizing alignment with the AWS platform, and ease of adoption as new services and products become available.
* You will help customers define target business outcomes and related work streams, and lead the subsequent projects and initiatives to consistently exceed these goals.
* As an Amazonian leader you will demonstrate the Amazon Leadership Principles, coaching and mentoring others on best practices, performance and career development.
* This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.


**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
* 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a highly technical and analytical role.
* 5+ years’ experience of Data Lake/Hadoop platform implementation, including 3+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning Hadoop/Spark implementations
* Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment.
* Experience with analytic solutions applied to the Marketing or Risk needs of enterprises


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in a Chief Data Architect role or similar
* Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math.
* Hands on experience leading large-scale global data warehousing and analytics projects.
* Ability to lead effectively across organizations.
* Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP and NoSQL databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting and Dashboard development.
* Demonstrated industry leadership in the fields of database, data warehousing or data sciences.
* Implementation and tuning experience specifically using Amazon Elastic Map Reduce (EMR).


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3113275

title: Head of Engineering Design
description:
Bravida är Nordens ledande leverantör av tekniska installations- och servicelösningar inom el, VVS, ventilation och automation. Med cirka 14 000 medarbetare och en omsättning på nära 30 miljarder kronor kombinerar vi lokal expertis med den stora organisationens resurser.
 



  





 Vi söker nu en
 **Head of Engineering Design** 
 som ska leda och utveckla
 **Bravida Engineering Design AB** 
 – vår interna designverksamhet som levererar multidisciplinära lösningar till projekt över hela Norden.
 



  





 Som ledare för ett 40-tal personer bestående av både Design Managers och ingenjörer får du en nyckelroll i att:
 


* Fortsätta bygga och utveckla en högpresterande designorganisation
* Driva digitalisering och moderna verktyg (t.ex. Revit, Autodesk Cloud)
* Säkerställa kvalitet, effektivitet och lönsamhet i projektleveransen
* Fortsätta och vidareutveckla arbetet med att positionera design som en strategisk och affärsdrivande funktion inom Bravida



  





 Vi söker dig som är en
 **erfaren ledare inom teknisk design eller projektering** 
 – en nytänkande och affärsdriven ledare med djup förståelse för tekniska installationer och en vilja att forma framtidens lösningar.
 



  





**Placering:** 
 Stockholm (resor inom Norden förekommer)
 



  





 För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta:
 **Matilda Andersson** 
 , Alumni Global, matilda.andersson@alumniglobal.com
 



  





 Läs mer och ansök via Head of Engineering Design, Bravida - Alumni Global

title: Fullstackutvecklare .NET, TCP/IP
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och nyfiken Senior .NET-utvecklare som vill bygga robusta och driftsäkra system med samhällsnytta i fokus
   

  

 Du trivs i gränslandet mellan backend, integration och systemarkitektur och drivs av att skapa lösningar som verkligen fungerar – även när det gäller. Du har ett öga för detaljer, förstår vikten av stabilitet och kvalitet och gillar att arbeta nära kollegor som delar samma engagemang för teknik och tillförlitlighet.
   

  

 Här blir du en del av ett team som utvecklar och vidareutvecklar centrala system i en verksamhetskritisk miljö. Tillsammans bygger ni lösningar som måste vara snabba, säkra och ständigt tillgängliga.
   

  

 Ditt uppdrag
   

  

 Som
 **Senior .NET-utvecklare** 
 arbetar du med att utveckla och förbättra backend-tjänster byggda i .NET Core och .NET Framework. Du bidrar till att skapa välstrukturerad, testbar och driftsäker kod, och du ser till att systemen fungerar även under hög belastning.
   

  

 Rollen innebär nära samarbete med andra utvecklare, testare och arkitekter i ett erfaret team. Du deltar i hela utvecklingskedjan – från analys av kommunikationsprotokoll och dataflöden till implementering, test och leverans. Du är bekväm med att läsa och förstå tekniska specifikationer från standardiseringsorgan och har en naturlig känsla för felhantering, fallback och redundans.
   

  

 Teamet arbetar huvudsakligen on-premise, så du trivs i en miljö där fokus ligger på stabil drift och vältestade lösningar snarare än molntjänster.
   

  

 Krav
   

  

 Flerårig erfarenhet av utveckling i
 **.NET Core** 
 och
 **.NET Framework**
 Goda kunskaper i
 **C#** 
 ,
 **Entity Framework** 
 och
 **SQL Server**
 Erfarenhet av
 **REST API** 
 ,
 **gRPC** 
 ,
 **HTTP** 
 och
 **TCP/IP**
 Förståelse för äldre kommunikationsprotokoll som
 **RS232C** 
 samt dataformat som
 **XML** 
 och
 **Protobuf**
 Erfarenhet av testning med
 **xUnit** 
 samt kodkvalitet med
 **SonarQube**
 Vana att arbeta med
 **Azure DevOps** 
 (pipelines) och
 **Git**
 Kännedom om
 **Serilog/SEQ** 
 för logghantering
   

  

 Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
   

  

 Meriterande
   

  

 Erfarenhet av
 **Angular** 
 eller annan frontend-teknik
   

  

 Intresse för UX och användarvänliga gränssnitt
   

  

 Erfarenhet av system med höga krav på tillgänglighet och säkerhet
   

  

 Förståelse för redundanta system, felhantering och fallback-logik

title: Experienced professionals to our SAP Finance team (Stockholm)
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 Deloitte is looking for talented and experienced professionals to join our SAP-team in Sweden. As a market leader, we work with both global and local organizations on complex transformations, including major business-driven IT changes. With approximately 25,000 SAP experts in over 135 countries, Deloitte is among SAP’s most valued strategic partners. This is why SAP has placed Deloitte within the highest strategic alliance partner category, and why we have been recognized as the Global Leader in SAP Services by leading consultancies and analysts such as Forrester and Gartner.
   

  

  





 We are looking for
 **senior SAP Finance professionals** 
 who have an appetite for delivering sustainable, business-driven projects and being excited to co-operate with the largest companies and well-known brands. You enjoy engaging with clients to understand their requirements and find solution options for key challenges in finance area providing subject matter expertise with a good awareness of SAP and associated technologies within the process area.
   

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Your most important attributes we’d like to see are:
   

  

  




* Thorough expertise in finance related SAP S/4HANA areas/competences such as Central Finance, FI/CO, Margin & Profitability Analysis, Project accounting with PS, Product Costing, Master Data modelling, Understanding of end to end process like Order to Cash, Procure to Pay or other
* Good understanding of SAP S/4HANA product roadmap (experience of other related SAP solutions such as e.g. Group Reporting, SAC is advantageous but not required) and knowledge of relevant delivery methods for SAP (waterfall, hybrid agile, agile) preferably with deployment experience e.g. global template rollouts
* Great addition (but not must) if the candidate has a high level understanding of the SAP cloud offerings -RISE and GROW


 Additionally, to ensure smooth start and succeeding in the role, it is required from the applicant to:
   

  

  

* Hold a master’s degree or similar relevant educational background with years of relevant SAP experience - preferably across multiple industries. Broad SAP functional and technical expertise in your own process area with a good understanding of integrations between SAP modules and other applications
* Have previous consulting, project delivery and sales/pre-sales experience working with multiple large clients both with business and IT stakeholders
* Be fluent in both written and spoken English with excellent communication and presentation skills, and an ability to conceptualize and communicate complex topics in a clear and understandable manner. Proficiency in Swedish language seen as an advantage but is not required.


**Additional Information**

**We offer**




 At Deloitte, we are committed to helping our employees grow and develop throughout their career. We offer a range of on-the-job learning experiences, formal development programs at Deloitte University, and access to a personal coach to support you in identifying and utilizing your strengths. We also provide the necessary training and resources for you to obtain various certifications to further advance in your career.
   

  

  

  

 Our culture is built on collaboration and innovation. We value diverse perspectives and encourage our employees to think creatively to find the best solutions for our clients. We work hand-in-hand with our clients to understand their unique needs and to develop tailored solutions that drive growth and innovation. At Deloitte, you´ll have the chance to grow and succeed alongside like-minded professionals who share your passion.
   

  

  

  

**How to apply**




 Your application should consist of a CV and a cover letter and you apply directly online. Please apply as soon as possible as we will review applications and interview candidates on an ongoing basis.
   

  

  

  

*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with To Find Out.* 
*https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/*
  

  

  

**Questions?**




 If you have any questions regarding the role or the application process, please contact Anna Taube, Manager Talent Acquisition at ataube@deloitte.se.
   

  

  





  

  

**We are looking forward to your application!**
  

  

  

 For further information on Deloitte, please visit
 
 www.deloitte.se
   

  

  






**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Senior Backend Engineer (Node.js)
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**Building internal tools that power world-class support — at scale 🚀**
 As we scale our operations from 30 to 60 countries, supporting millions of users and partners, our internal tools need to scale with us. The Support Engineering group is at the heart of this mission. We build high-performance admin applications and core operational tools that empower our support teams to work smarter and faster. A key part of this is our in-house chat platform, which already handles around 5 million conversations every month. On top of this foundation, we’re developing advanced features to reduce manual work, improve communication, and proactively resolve issues — often before our users even notice them.
   

  

 Our systems range from automated reach-outs for delayed orders to deeply integrated tools that enable our support teams to deliver assistance quickly, reliably, and with a human touch. By removing inefficiencies and automating repetitive tasks, we’re ensuring that Wolt’s 25M+ users and 300K+ partners receive world-class support at scale.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a
 **Senior Backend Engineer (Node.js)** 
 to join us in building scalable, low-latency systems that power these tools and shape the future of customer support at Wolt. You’ll work on impactful products that directly influence how millions of people experience Wolt every day.
   

  

 📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Finland or Sweden!
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Build and maintain high-throughput backend services using Node.js.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and frontend developers to ship features that support internal support agents across the globe.
* Design systems that are scalable, resilient, and easy to maintain.
* Lead and contribute to architectural discussions and technical decision-making.
* Write well-tested code and help the team maintain high code quality standards.
* Take ownership of services end-to-end — from design and implementation to monitoring and ongoing improvements.


 Our humble expectations:
   

  

* 7+ years of production experience in Node.js, with the ability to mentor others in best practices.
* Strong experience with SQL and NoSQL databases - especially MongoDb, PostgreSQL.
* Experience designing and operating low-latency, high-throughput distributed systems is a big plus.
* Product-oriented mindset — we value engineers who think beyond the ticket and understand the “why” behind the work.
* Experience in leading projects or making key technical decisions is expected at this level.
* Proven experience owning projects or components and driving them to completion.
* Clear communicator with a collaborative spirit — we move fast, but we do it together.


**Nice to have:**
* Background in Golang or other backend languages.
* Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP) and event-driven architectures.
* Previous on-call experience, with a pragmatic approach to reliability and incident management. We support healthy, balanced on-call practices and make sure responsibility is shared fairly.


 Next steps:
   

  

 We review applications on a rolling basis and encourage you to apply as soon as you feel excited about this opportunity. If you need any adjustments in our hiring process (for example, related to accessibility, caregiving, or personal circumstances), let us know — we’ll be happy to support.
   

  

 Are you curious about our hiring process? Check out our careers page for more info
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Product Engineer
description:
At HMS Industrial Networks, we know our people are the key to our success. We take pride in nurturing a culture that’s inclusive, curious, and welcoming – where every employee is supported in growing both personally and professionally.


Are you curious about how ideas turn into real products? Do you enjoy connecting people, technology, and processes to make things work smoothly? We’re now looking for a Product Engineer to join our Hardware team within the Industrial Network Technology (INT) Division in Halmstad.


This is a great opportunity for someone early in their career who wants to grow in a role that combines coordination, communication, and engineering understanding. You’ll be part of a supportive team working at the intersection of product development and production – helping to make our products reliable, efficient, and ready for the future.


ABOUT THE ROLE


As a Product Engineer, you’ll play a key role in connecting our production and hardware development team. You’ll make sure that our hardware products are manufacturable, reliable, and continuously improving throughout their lifecycle.


Your work will involve:

* Coordinating component lifecycle activities – identifying and qualifying alternatives for end-of-life parts.
* Supporting production and R&D teams with technical coordination and improvement initiatives.
* Bringing a Design for Manufacturing perspective early in product development.
* Contributing to cost and quality improvements and keeping documentation up to date.


This is a broad and collaborative role, where you’ll get to work with many stakeholders and learn a lot about both technology and processes. It’s well suited for someone who enjoys variety, problem-solving, and teamwork more than deep specialization.


ABOUT YOU


You’re a curious and engaged person who enjoys learning and making a difference through collaboration.You like understanding how things fit together and finding practical ways to improve them.


You may be newly graduated or have a few years of experience — what matters most is your motivation and ability to build relationships and create structure.


We think you’ll thrive if you:

* Have a degree in electronics, industrial engineering, production engineering, development engineering, or a similar field.
* Enjoy working across disciplines and communicating with people from different backgrounds.
* Are comfortable taking initiative and following things through.
* Are fluent in English; Swedish is a plus.


We value openness, teamwork, and continuous learning — and we believe diverse perspectives make us stronger.


ABOUT US


HMS Networks makes the World more connected, productive and sustainable. Our industrial communication products enable millions of machines such as robots, drives and air-conditioners to get connected to software and systems — A necessity to meet the future demands for energy efficiency and sustainability.


We are an innovative growth company based in Halmstad, Sweden with 1100 employees in more than 20 countries.


HMS is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an environment where everyone feels included, respected, and empowered.


Want to help us make the world more connected and sustainable? Visit hms-networks.com or look us up on social media.

  

ABOUT THE APPLICATION


Join us in pushing the boundaries of technology and making a significant impact on the industry. Apply today to be part of a team that values your unique perspective and expertise!


The selection process is ongoing, so we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.


If you want to know more about the role or the recruitment process, please contact responsible recruiter.


Welcome with your application!
