title: Field Service Engineer – Robotic Waterjet Systems
description:
*Shape Process Automation EMEA is seeking a skilled and motivated Field Service Engineer to join our European team. For this position you need to be located in Midlands, Staffordshire; UK. If you have a passion for robotics, precision engineering, and global travel, this is your opportunity to work with cutting-edge UHP waterjet cutting systems in a dynamic, international environment.*

**ABOUT US**

*For more than 50 years, Shape Process Automation (SPA) has been continuously developing the areas of robotics, automation, and system integration. With facilities located at various international locations, we handle large-scale advanced manufacturing needs globally. SPA is an industry leader in the manufacturing of robotized 3D trimming. We are at the forefront of robotics and the overall efficiency of equipment when it comes to automation.*

*Our European headquarters are in Karlshamn, Sweden, where approximately 130 employees work with customized automation solutions. Within our aftermarket department, we have two dedicated service teams—one focused on UHP waterjet cutting systems and the other supporting various automation systems across Sweden and internationally.*

**JOB DESCRIPTION**


As a Field Service Engineer at SPA, you’ll play a key role in delivering and supporting high-performance robotic UHP waterjet systems to customers located across the UK and globally.


The role includes turn-key system installation and commissioning, implementing service contracts, upgrades, retrofits, on-site and remote troubleshooting, and supporting our project managers, sales, and AM team with technical assistance and customer inquiries.


Robot programming and software/path changes using both offline and online methods, providing training to customers, and identifying sales opportunities for additional systems or services are also among your responsibilities.


Regular travel to customer sites in the UK and abroad is required.


This role demands strong technical expertise, adaptability, and a customer-focused mindset. You’ll be the face of SPA’s aftermarket service—ensuring our systems are running smoothly and efficiently for our customers.


**Location**


Midlands, Staffordshire area.


Home-based with travel.

**What We Offer**


In addition to a rewarding role in a global automation company, we offer a fully expensed company car, generous holiday allowance, and all tools you need to succeed— phone, laptop, and specialist equipment are also provided.


Our comprehensive benefits package includes pension and healthcare coverage, plus access to an incentive plan that rewards your contributions.


You’ll benefit from ongoing training and development opportunities, and work in a truly international environment where independence, accountability, and collaboration are valued every day.

**What You’ll Need to Succeed**


We’re looking for someone with a solid technical foundation and hands-on experience in automation. You should hold an HNC/HND or equivalent in an electrical discipline, ideally complemented by a degree in a relevant technical field. Your background may include mechanical, electrical, robotics, controls, field service, or programming experience.


You’ll need strong mechanical aptitude, with the ability to repair or replace components confidently. A good understanding of PLC communications and robotic peripheral equipment is essential. Clear and professional communication in English—both written and verbal—is a must, along with proficiency in MS Office. As this role involves regular travel, a full UK driving license is required.


**Competence and experience**


We’re especially interested in candidates with hands-on experience in Robotics, PLC’s and hydraulic systems. A strong foundation in electronics and mechanics is highly valued—particularly when it comes to troubleshooting, repairing and servicing across these systems.


Familiarity with Siemens PLC (TIA/Step7) and ABB industrial robots will give you a strong advantage in this role.


If you have a background in customer service and thrive working independently without supervision, you’ll fit right in.


**Who You Are**


You’re someone who takes pride in delivering exceptional service—proactively meeting the needs of both customers and colleagues. You bring your skills and experience to every task with confidence and a commitment to high-quality results. You must be a strong team member and thrive in a team environment where cooperation and mutual support are key, but also you can take the initiative and find smart, effective ways to solve problems. You’re open to new ideas and creative approaches, always looking for better ways to get things done.

**How to Apply**  

We welcome your application and encourage you to submit it as soon as possible. Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis, so early applications are appreciated. Please apply via our website.

**Questions**


Please contact Mr. Peter Norris, Aftermarket Manager, Phone number: +44 7917171325, email: peter.norris@shapetechnologies.com

 **Please VISIT OUR WEBSITEs TO DISOVER MORE**

 **Shape Process Automation Europe**

  

Regular travel to customer sites in the UK and abroad is required. Good physical condition is required.

title: Montörer av avancerad elektronik till ACTIA EMS Sweden AB
description:
**Application Deadline:** Dec. 31, 2025 Linköping On-site
  
  

Om företaget.
  
  

ACTIA EMS Sweden AB (”ACTIA EMS”) är en tillverkare av elektronik med kontor och produktion i Mjärdevi, Linköping. Här arbetar 35 engagerade medarbetare, lika många kvinnor som män, med att förse nationella och internationella kunder med spjutspetselektronik för en mängd olika användningsområden.
  
  

Vi har en hög orderingång och behöver därför förstärka vår grupp.
  
  

**Om rollen:**  

Vi söker nu dig som vill arbeta som montör av avancerad elektronik hos oss.
  
  

Rolle innebär att du får en omväxlande arbetsdag, där du bland annat kommer att:
  
  

Monterar komplex elektronik till en rad olika kunder.
  
Sköter sluttestning av produkter innan de levereras till kund.
  
Sköter om och övervakar vår produktionsutrustning.
  
Är delaktig i vår produktionsprocess vid uppstart av nya produkter och linor.
  
  

På ACTIA EMS är vi mycket stolta över det vi gör, och vi vill alltid överträffa våra kunders förväntningar. Därför tummar vi aldrig på vår kvalité eller vår leveransprecision. Vill kunden ha sin produkt tillverkad till ett visst datum, gör vi allt för att tillmötesgå kunden, så hen får sin produkt i rätt tid och med en fenomenal kvalité.
  
  

Tjänsten är på 100%.
  
  

Observera att vid höga arbetstoppar förekommer tvåskift samt helgarbete. Detta meddelas dock alltid i god tid.
  
  

Arvid Trygg
  
Software Development Engineer
  
"At ACTIA, you are never stuck alone with a problem. Everybody wants to help you succeed in your work. That is for me a huge advantage when it comes to developing the best solutions"
  
Kais Trabelsi
  
SW Line Manager
  
"Here, you have the opportunity to influence all decisions made. We are close to the management, you can express your opinions freely and it is a workplace culture with friendly, respectful colleagues."
  
Skills & Requirements
  
  

**Om dig:**  

Då vi arbetar med kunder inom en rad olika branscher, har vi högt ställda krav på våra medarbetare:
  
  

**Skallkrav:**  

Du har en gymnasieexamen.
  
Du är svensk medborgare.
  
Du talar och läser svenska samt engelska.
  
  

Observera även att vi kan komma att fråga om utdrag ur belastningsregister.
  
  

**Personliga egenskaper:**  

Du har en hög energinivå och vill bidra till att vidareutveckla vår verksamhet med ditt engagemang.
  
Du är en doer. Du tycker bättre om när det är mycket att göra, än när det är lite att göra.
  
Du är van vid att arbeta med verktyg.
  
Du är noggrann och kvalitetsmedveten.
  
Du kan följa både skriftliga och muntliga instruktioner.
  
Du är en schysst kollega som behandlar dina medmänniskor väl!
  
Du är teknikintresserad och har god datorvana.
  
Du balanserar väl med gruppen och sätter laget före jaget.
  
  

**Meriterande egenskaper:**  

Du har tidigare erfarenhet av arbete med montering/test av elektronik.
  
Du har läst el/tele eller teknik på gymnasiet.
  
  

Som montör på ACTIA EMS kommer du få chansen att utveckla både dig själv och din erfarenhet av elektroniktillverkning inom ett eller flera av våra områden. Du erbjuds även goda utvecklingsmöjligheter inom våra andra områden; till exempel kan du arbeta som operatör, eller så börjar du arbeta med logistik eller beredning. Det är helt upp till dig, beroende på ditt driv och engagemang.
  
  

Vi ser till så att du kommer igång i arbetet, och ger dig den upplärning du behöver för att du på sikt ska bli självgående och ett proffs!
  
  

Välkommen till oss, vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!
  
  

Full-spectrum development. From SW to HW
  
  

In-house production. Full insight and control
  
  

Workplace flexibility. Hybrid work set-up
  
  

High-profile clients – global well-known brands
  
  

Company health care and health insurance
  
  

Flat organization. Collaborate and innovate freely
  
  

About the company
  
  

Welcome to the technology leader in connectivity
  
ACTIA’s products are used in millions of applications worldwide, mainly in the automotive industry. We are a part of the global ACTIA Group, but our workplace culture is characterized by the closeness, innovativeness and flexibility of a smaller company. As an employee at ACTIA, you have the opportunity to work with world-leading technology in the entire chain from software, to hardware, production and ancillary services. It provides a valuable and exciting overall perspective where you can see every technical detail develop together with your colleagues. We are looking for everybody who is attracted by challenging, forefront technology, and who have high expectations for both your own and your workplace's development.
  
  

Our Core Values
  
  

Care
  
The wellbeing of people and environment is important to us and we make long-term sustainable choices.
  
  

Courage
  
We empower each other and seek opportunities to develop both individuals and as a company.
  
  

Dedication
  
We take a genuine interest in our client’s business and strive for excellence together.
  
  

Trust
  
We create safe and efficient technology that both our customers and society can rely on.
  
  

Oscar Bentevik Holm | Contact Person

title: Electrical & Pneumatic Design engineer
description:
**Electrical & Pneumatic Design engineer**
==========================================

Functional area: Engineering
Location: Sweden
City: Värnamo
Company name: Swed-Weld AB
Date of posting: Oct 22, 2025  

**Your role**
-------------



Are you passionate and skilled in electricity and have the ability to make electrician drawings as well as pneumatic and collaborating closely with customers in automation?

  


**AEC Nordic (Swedweld)** is looking for a **Electrical & Pneumatic Design engineer**, to join our team and grow into an expert on our Feeder system. As our Electrical & Pneumatic Design engineer, you will play a key role in configuring, supporting, and implementing our Feeder systems to meet customer requirements, when it comes to Electrical design.

  


**Your responsibilities will include:**

  


* Electrician drawings – Support internally as well as our Customer with Electrician drawings. We are working in the software E-Plan as platform for the design.
* Customer Interaction – Collaborating directly with customers to understand their system setup needs for Feeder and Tightening projects, regards to electrician components
* Customer Support – Be part of our support to customers and in some cases join our team in the commissioning phase of our systems.
* Service & Troubleshooting – Contributing to problem-solving efforts and providing technical support for ongoing operations.
* Internal Collaboration – Analysing requests, providing solutions, and supporting colleagues in system setup to strengthen team capabilities and drive continuous improvement.
* Production System Setup – Hands-on involvement in assembling, testing, and configuring feeders in our production facility before delivery, ensuring each system meets the highest quality standards.
**To succeed, you will need**
-----------------------------

  

* Electrician design skills and experience to make electrical design and drawings.
* It is beneficial if you have experience of E-Plan or/and P-Plan in the Electrically or Pneumatic design.
* Knowledge and experience in Automation projects.
* Analytic and project management skills.
* Excellent communication skills and experience collaborating with customers and internal stakeholders.
* Ability to work independently and identify the best solutions for complex systems.

  



You are a technically curious and solution-oriented professional who enjoys combining hands-on work with customer interaction. You take pride in delivering high-quality results and are motivated to grow your expertise in automation systems.

  



We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. We value diverse experiences and perspectives and are excited to see what you bring to the role.

**In return, we offer**
-----------------------


* A collaborative and inclusive work environment where your contributions truly matter.
* Opportunities to work on high-impact projects with global exposure.
* A culture that values innovation, continuous improvement, and personal development.
* Hands-on experience with cutting-edge automation systems in a growing company.
**Job location**
----------------



Based in **Värnamo**, Southern Sweden, this role offers the opportunity to work on innovative automation projects and support our customers in achieving optimal system performance.

  



Some travel is required to succeed in this mission.

  


**Uniting curious minds**  

Behind every innovative solution, there are people working together to transform the future. With careers sparked by initiative and lifelong learning, we unite curious minds, and you could be one of them.

title: Control system Development Engineer
emails: vanesa.hadziselimovic@siemens-energy.com, mikael.nimvall@siemens-energy.com, unionen.finspang.se@siemens-energy.com, asi.se@siemens-energy.com, anders.fors@siemens-energy.com, mikael.malmgren@siemens-energy.com
description:
**A snapshot of your day**


Are you passionate about Control system technologies, innovation and implementing new ideas to strengthen our products? We’re growing and looking for a Control system development engineer to join our R&D I&C department. As a part of our team, you will develop and maintain control system software applications for our gas turbines ensuring our products meet the requirements set in the market.


The position requires close collaboration and working alongside other departments and designers to integrate control system into the overall design of MGT products.

**How You Will Make an Impact**

* Be a part of a high skilled development team responsible for the development and maintenance of control system software applications for the MGT products.
* Be responsible for the engineering work and technical solutions in the assigned development projects, working closely with the project team and project manager to ensure that the design meets specified requirements aligned with the technical road map.
* Contribute to develop work processes and way of working for better team and development project outcomes within the team´s responsibility.
* Continuously gain new skills and knowledge and share those by learning and supporting others continually over time.

 **What You Will Bring**

* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in electrical engineering or a related field.
* Extensive and multi-year experience of working with automation and control technologies with interest in new technologies and the use of existing technologies in new contexts.
* Extensive knowledge in PCS7 or T3000. Other related systems are advantageous.
* Proficient English skills allowing you to express yourself with a high level of fluency and communicate effectively at a professional level.
* Excellent set of interpersonal skills in combination with experience working with colleagues and customers in international settings.
* It is advantageous if you have experience working with:
* + Modeling and simulation in Matlab or a related tool.
	+ Functional Safety (SIL)
	+ Cyber Security


Our **Gas Services division** offers Low-emission power generation through service and decarbonization. Zero or low emission power generation and all gas turbines under one roof, steam turbines and generators. Decarbonization opportunities through service offerings, modernization, and digitalization of the fleet.


We can offer you employment benefits such as: reduction of working hours, advance vacation, health care allowance and an eventual possibility to a flexible working place.

**Who is Siemens Energy?**


At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. With ~100,000 dedicated employees in more than 90 countries, we develop the energy systems of the future, ensuring that the growing energy demand of the global community is met reliably and sustainably. The technologies created in our research departments and factories drive the energy transition and provide the base for one sixth of the world's electricity generation.


Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.


Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

**Our Commitment to Diversity**


Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

**Application**


Don’t hesitate – apply via https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/en\_US/jobs id nr 283438 not later than 2025-11-12


Ongoing selection is applied, the role might be filled before last application date.


For questions about the role, please contact the recruiting manager Vanesa Hadziselimovic on vanesa.hadziselimovic@siemens-energy.com


For questions about the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter Mikael Nimvall on mikael.nimvall@siemens-energy.com


We refrain from all contact with staffing and recruitment companies, or advertising brokers.

title: Power System Consultant - Energy Management
description:
**Location:**

Gothenburg, Vastra Gotaland County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0107875
**Date Posted:**

2025-10-22
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The Opportunity**

Seize this opportunity to take on a highly visible position in a global organization. As a Power System Consultant – Energy management you will belong to Power Consulting, a department within Hitachi Energy working with both internal and external clients in the energy sector. You will be part of a renowned global team of power system and energy consultants. In the role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the green transition and create a more sustainable energy future for all.


So, if you want to take the next step in your career, and contribute to develop a stronger, smarter, and greener energy system – Join us now! We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join it!


**How you’ll make an impact**

* In this exciting role, you will get the opportunity to take part in major assignments related to the green energy transition together with our consultants and experts from local as well as international Power Consulting offices.
* Deliver sustainability analyses such as Life cycle analyses (LCAs), energy audits, Net-Zero roadmaps.
* Perform system studies in areas such as HVDC, FACTS, renewables, green hydrogen, and power systems, including cost-technology optimization analyses.
* Cooperation and work in teams with leading specialists together with Hitachi Energy well-defined career path ensures exciting and motivating career with fast development along own interests and personality traits.
* You will be living Hitachi Energy core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

**Your background**

* You hold a Master’s degree in electrical engineering, electrical power systems or similar.
* You have a great interest and preferably a couple of years of experience in the consulting and energy sector.
* Strong knowledge in energy optimization, cost-benefit analysis, energy markets, microgrids, energy flexibility in multi energy vector systems.
* Knowledge in power systems analysis and in software simulation tools such as PSS/E, PSCAD and/or DIgSILENT PowerFactory. Programming skills in Python, C++, etc. is a merit.
* You have an analytical mindset, you are independent, self-going and take your own initiatives to solve problems.
* Strong interest and general knowledge within sustainability topics
* As a person, you are collaborative and communicative.
* It is necessary to be fluent in English. Swedish is meritorious

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role

**More about us**

The position is based in Gothenburg or Stockholm (Solna).


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


Recruiting Manager, Cecilia Karlsson, cecilia.karlsson@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 25 73; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner, Tobias Nilsson, tobias.n.nilsson@hitachienergy.com .


**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**
